text: Average and overpriced.  The sausage and pork katsu was dry.  The food is made with no care. Disappointing.
VERY delicious curry! I usually get their chicken katsu curry. The owner is Japanese and is very nice. Steve Aoki comes and eats here too :)

After experiencing their first location in China town I was excited to see one open up closer to home. It's not true what they when the sequel is not as good as the original. Better parking and not as hectic as the other location this one will be my go to. Now I don't have to dread every time I get a curry craving. 

Definitely try the takoyaki: warm, soft and delicious. Took me by surprise and made the perfect pairing to my spinach curry with a side of pork katsu. And don't think their level of spicy is on par with other restaurants, I love spicy food and normally get the max rating but I was pleasantly surprised that this had a kick. 

To make a long story short: will be back!
Food and service is always awesome!! I love how they keep the ginger and onions available for you on their table instead of giving it to you limited.
It was my first time eating at this location. The restaurant was clean and has a cozy environment. The employees were friendly and the food came hot, tasty, and decently sized.

The one on spring mountain is more better based on service . The taste is the same but it takes ages for my food to come out . Literally 15-20 minutes while th e one on spring mountain takes 3-5 minutes to come out. It's not even restaurant quality it's like a quick in and out . Similar to like McDonald's of something . The one on spring mountain has the authentic feel to it . They mess up orders from the two times I came here so make sure you repeat the order twice to make sure ...
The food is ok not great!!! Tonkatsu on Jones is better!!! Probably wont come back again! Wanted to like it since its close to the house!
Went here for the first time today and ordered the katsu curry it was amazing! Employee who helped us order was very helpful and friendly! Will for sure be back!!

I think the quality of the food is the same as the original in Chinatown. Pretty consistent on the spice level. I love heat, but a 4 is plenty spicy for me.

I wish they kept the same full service concept as the original. It's a little weird eating your food from a to-go container in the restaurant. I love the pickled veggies and almonds, but wish they had them on every table. This would save my lazy butt from getting up to refill when I run out.

Go! Go Now!!! I'd eat here everyday if I could. Curry udon (sub chicken for pork), add boiled egg and spice it up to level 5 and it's otherworldly! Have no fear, the gyozas are not from Trader Joe's; they're delicately delicious. The Absolutely lovely love of a lady (I'm embarrassed to say I've forgotten her name :/) remembers us every time and what we order. Oops...I guess I go there more than I thought and this reminds me that next time I need to get the chicken katsu- which I know is full of flavor and not overly fried. Beyond yum of a place!

I was stationed in Okinawa Japan for two years and as many of us do grew to love the curry from CoCo IchiBan. Since leaving Japan I have tried the curry at multiple restaurants and have yet to fill that void of delicious Curry.....that is until a few days ago when I found Zen Curry. I have now had it twice and it's hands down the best curry I've had in Vegas.

Been here so much, they know my name and order when I walk in or call now. 

I cannot get enough of this place!! Absolutely amazing service, and the curry, soooo good!!!
Great friendly service! :) loved my curry udon noodle! Amazing food. I'll definitely be back! I'm now hooked on there tasty food!

I would normally rate this 4/5 stars cause every time I come here and take food to go, everything is usually on point. But I am just really disappointed this time. We decided to eat at the restaurant and ordered the curry udon, chicken katsu, and the shumai. ( our usual order) So we ordered and sat down and waited for our order.. there were maybe 2 people ahead of us and 15 minutes later our shumai comes out.. and seriously it looked a little dark, but we just assumed it was maybe cooked too long so I took one bite and it's cold inside.. I called the girl over and said I'm sorry but I think these have been re-fried and they're cold inside.. the girl apologizes but picks them up and loudly says to the cook "hey you, cold shumai" in front of everyone as she took them away. Now our udon is out and it's delicious, no problem there. The chicken katsu was good too. But here comes the new shumai.. and I swear it's the same just re-fried again.. if I'm upset at the fact my food looks re-fried and cold inside, you don't RE FRY MY OLD RE-FRIED food. I took one bite just for the hell of it and it's still COLD INSIDE. so we didn't even eat the shumai.. so disappointing. ALSO, I get that this joint is kind of a fast food place and it's more casual, but it's really discerning when the cashier is just out and about chatting up with some friends who came to visit.. as we were trying to put our dish away into the bin ( which was full ) and we looked at the cashier chatting away and she just stared at us like.. what? .. so we just dropped the dishes inside and it looked like it was going to spill.. so, thanks for the udon and katsu, but please try to not re fry your food and try to stay a little more professional. Thank you !

All I got to say is that Spring Mountain location and food is better!!! We tried the spring mountain place first and was awesome. We saw that there was location on rainbow and looked up menu different from spring mountain. Went in to try it and the taste is better at spring mountain very different here did not taste right. Portion kinda the same but the original place is always better. Well tried it and will not be back. Highly recommend spring mountain instead of this place.

A new Japanese style curry restaurant with ADDICTIVE curry sauce and katsu. The food is delicious and orders take 5-10 minutes to prepare,  so if you are in a rush I suggest calling ahead. 


I love spicy food and pride myself on my ability to handle it. If you are like me then try level 7 spiciness! It's just the right balance between pain and pleasure lol. 

Decor and setup could use work but it's a new restaurant that appears to be changing each time I walk in so I'll let them slide. The import thing is that the food is HOT,  DELICIOUS and CONSISTENT!

I usually upload a pic or two whenever I post a review on yelp because "picture can describe 1000 words"... Right ? Well, no... Not this place. You just have to come in to find out yourself because those pics I took would not do justice to zen's "amazingness". 

My recommendation : shrimp curry or curry udon. Level 5 is pretty spicy already and I have high tolerance for spicy food
I love this place. My boyfriend and I always come here. The service is always great, comfortable environment, and the chicken katsu curry is delicious!

I've been to curry zen too many times to count, mainly because I love their prices, their food tastes good, and I can always get in and out for a quick lunch. 

But this location has its problems. First is the open view of the kitchen, which kinda spoiled the magic for me. Seeing them microwave unwashed vegetables... Kinda gross. Then there's the fact that half the time there's a funky smell in the place that smells like a gross mixture of sanitizer of methane.
So i love Japanese curry and they closed down the one I went to near my work so finding this jewel in Vegas was awesome! My husband could care less since he ordered the beef curry. :)
Good foods , cashier very knowledge about their product and since this is our time, the cashier took her time to explained to Us, the inly problem, very very hot inside the restaurant

enjoy this spot better then the original location. It's not as crowded and nice to enjoy your meal at.  Because they aren't as busy it seems the quality of their food is much better then the original location. The service is great and the cashiers are always nice and very friendly. The eating area is small but very clean and the bathroom is kept up. The servers also check on you often. Same great recipes as the original location but a little more consistent when it comes their heat scale. I always love zen curry.

Had the vegetable curry, and man was it delicious! The veggies were cooked just the way I like them, and the entire flavor profile of the curry itself was richly seasoned and suited to please your taste buds on so many levels. I would keep coming back here just for this one dish, but there are many more to try!

The counter staff was very friendly. The environment is very nicely decorated. There is pop/club music on the speaker overhead which I don't think goes well with the food. But that's not enough to stop me from coming back.

Happy mouth, happy customer.

I don't miss a lot about Vegas since moving, but I miss these guys all the time. I ordered so often that the wonderful young woman who always answered recognized me on the phone just by my order. They're always so friendly and fast here. They'll help you customize your order so you can get exactly what you want. My toddler is super picky, but she would happily scarf down the udon noodles and the chicken katsu. Try their calamari! It was always made PERFECTLY. Their thai tea is fantastic too!
Delicious!  Their prices are very reasonable for their Curry.  Remember to ask for radishes to top off your curry.
One-stop japanese curry place. With all kind of different curry combinations to choose from, you will be amazed by the quality of food.

Delievery chicken katcu curry(spicy 10), original curry/shrimp tempura(spicy 5) n fried oyster.

Taste of everything was very good. I wish more curry on the dish.

Great service. Excellent Curry. If you have spent any time in Okinawa, this will remind you of Cocos. We have eaten here, taken it to go and have also called it in so that it was ready for us. 

I normally order the Chicken Katsu Curry, Spice level two...with cheese and a salad with sesame dressing. Never disappoints.

No frills, casual dining with limited seating but good service and good curry. You get exactly what you pay for. Between all the curries, the pork katsu is my favorite. Decent sized portions and crispy katsu. Great place for take-out to enjoy at home. The store doesn't look much from the outside, but give it a chance.

So terrible service. I called at 2p.m on April 19th, the server who got my call asked me to hold on to get the address, I waited for 3 mins and she just hung up. We ordered for delivery, always asked for the RADDISH which always come with when I dining in. But they never put the RADDISH except for one time. They never read instruction. The spicy level is Spicer than it should be. 
The server (lady) avoid the responsibility to driver that the driver should have checked if there is everything. No, it's restaurant's responsibility to check everything. I asked to re-deliever food, she said she will get a paper and pen, and hung up; never called back. As a curry zen lover, I am very disappointed about the service and rudeness.

My go to place when I'm too lazy to cook. My favorite is the spinach katsu curry. I usually get it with medium spice. Sometimes when I want to sweat I'll take it to the max. Wonder if I'm burning any calories with all that sweat.

For my daughter, I usually get her a side order of katsu and rice. It under $6 so that's a cheap good dinner.

I recommend calling ahead if you plan out take out.
Good food. Came for lunch and turned out just as good as the spring mountain location.

Curry zen is one of the best curry places in town, however this location can do with more kitchen training. 
I came in just before the dinner rush hour, yet the wait time for my food was pretty long. With 4 people working in the kitchen and help from the cashier you would think things would have gone more smoothly and quickly. Other tables that came after us were already getting their fill of curry while we just sat and waited for curry ramen. This happened to the point where the cashier acknowledged our wait time and pushed the kitchen to make our ramen which then had undercooked noodles and lacked the spice level that we paid extra for.

2nd time here. both times we ordered the chicken katsu curry. VERY tasty. my wife got the spice level 1 and i got the level 2. perfect level of spice. 

customer service is very good. 

definitely going to be our go to spot for curry.

Convenient location for the people living in the SW area of Las Vegas providing quick and easy japanese curry cuisine. This is the first time I've been to this location. 

My friend had ordered it by app previously and scheduled for pick-up at 1130. I had arrived a few minutes before 1130 to the food was still being prepared. For the most part, everything was prepped and ready on time. Only downside is i wish they would have double bagged the bag with the 3 curry udon. One bag was kind of weak which caused one of the handles to break and drop on the ground. Luckily the containers are fairly sturdy so minimal sauce was loss. On the bright side, everything was nice and hot (also the reason why i didnt carry from the bottom because it was HOT). 

The udon was a bit overcooked (not sure if it was due to the travel time to pick up some drinks at a nearby place or it was overcooked originally. Otherwise, typical japanese curry. Too bad they do a slight extra charge for spice. Would have loved to have it spicy (me being a cheap chinese and i wasnt the one ordering... forgot to state it oops) 

Previous to visiting this location, i for some reason thought this was a to-go only location but upon entering the location, they have some small tables spread around. Good for small parties looking for a quick lunch.

This place would be amazing if they were more like the one in Chinatown. I prefer it to not be so takeout orientated. I dont see many people picking up the food to go so I am not sure why it is setup to be like a takeout place. I prefer real silverware, plates, bowls, glasses etc. The food is good but loaded w msg. I have been debating the superior species, Rina K about the ramifications or drawbacks of MSG. I guess I would prefer it isnt loaded with MSG, but at the end of the day it tastes great lol. Overall upgrade the plates and utensils and I think it would be a better experience. Just saying!

Update... Tatstes like the original.. love it

Took my family there this weekend and we have chicken katsu, Japanese sausage, and grill chicken & onion curry. Man it was good. "3" is spicy enough. The price is reasonable. The place is small since it's an express restaurant of Curry Zen. The employees are nice and friendly. Great customer service. Would definitely go back for some more curry. We tried Thai, India, and now Japanese curry. They all have great taste and flavor. Best of all, they have a free water machine, you'll need it if you go pass "4" on the spicy list.

At first I was a little hesitant on trying katsu curry but I love katsu and curry so why wouldn't it be amazing!? I got the chicken katsu curry with a fried egg, level 3 spicy, and fried shumai. It was delicious! I love really spicy foods and level 3 was perfect for me.

Delicious and crispy katsu,  yummy gravy like curry spicy level 6, and good service.  It was a delight to eat in a not so good setting.  I also loved the pickled condiments.  The best katsu I've tried :)

I was driving by and saw this place. Easy to miss if you're not looking for it. The signage outside says "Curry Zen Express" and the inside suggests exactly that. It's very casual and not really meant to be a sit down restaurant, in my opinion.

The curry itself, was just OK. It wasn't bad. It wasn't good. It's good to know that now I have curry as an option on this side of town when I don't feel like cooking, but nothing WOW about it. I got the chicken katsu curry, and I really should have gotten it spicier. It may make it better. 

As for the service, again, it wasn't bad. The food took a bit of time to come out and I felt like they could be slightly more efficient but who am I to judge. 

Overall, not bad. Not great, but definitely worth another visit to try the spicier version of the curry.

** UPDATE: I went back and got the spicier curry (level 3) and it was just enough spice. It's borderline too spicy for people who can't handle spiciness well. As before, the curry was OK and to reiterate, not a bad place for those nights when you don't feel like cooking and want somewhat of a homecooked type of meal. **

I have been here a couple of times. This is my go to place if I need a Japanese curry fix. I always get the chicken katsu  but today I went for the pork katsu. It was just as good the pork is a thicker cut but just as good.

 The dining room is small but they have some counter seats on the side. If you order drinks the small fridge is on the counter they tell u to help yourself after you pay. No soda fountain!! Boooo oh well.... 

  The service is just ok nothing great here just the basics! I feel it's just enough to get by. The counter girl is not friendly but she does her job of taking your order and bringing out your food.

  With all of that the food is good and they have lots of sides. I love the curry and will continue to eat here. Check this place out and see for yourself if Japanese curry is your thing!!! Happy eating

Why have I never noticed this place? Such reasonable priced and awesome service.
I went with the chicken katsu curry. The spice level goes to 10, I got level 3. For me, it was a bit spicy and I think I'll get a 1 or 2 next time but it was so delicious. I added vegetables to mine and it really added some substance.
The katsu was perfectly cooked and flavored. Super juicy and the perfect texture. Sometimes chicken katsu is overly done where the panko scrapes your mouth... Not the case here! It was perfect.
I loved the curry sauce but like I said, I'll opt out of the spice next time.
I wish they had fountain drinks but they only have canned drinks, bottled water and then complimentary water dispenser. 
I also got mochi. The green tea one tasted like play doh but the strawberry one was amazing. I don't think they are house made but either way it hit the spot.
I'm excited to keep coming here, good prices and portions!

I eat her constantly. I love the food most of the time but they have a huge issue with consistency. I order the same thing each time: spinach curry with chicken Katsu spice level 9. Sometimes there's more curry than rice, some times the spice level isn't consistent (a level 9 tastes like a level 5 on certain days) and the chicken is rarely ever perfect. Sometimes it's hard as a rock and other times it's super soft with barely any breading. It's frustrating to come here each time and wonder if they're gonna have a good day or bad day in terms of how their food tastes.

We order from this location at least twice a week -- great price, quick service and always piping hot. Spice level can vary regardless of what you order but it's a niggling detail.

The portions generally run towards generous, the brown and white rice is excellent and made very well.

I've also eaten in at the other location and it's a nice clean joint.
The curry is awesome! When they say spicy, they mean it! Carefully when ordering your spice level.

This Jewel is hidden in a shopping plaza when it should have a stand alone building and a drive thru window! The Japanese Curry here is perfect to Me. I spent 3yrs living in Okinawa Japan since I've been back to the states this is the closest thing to CoCos or and exact copy. The food is delicious.  Here you order the curry in oz not grams like Japan. The customer service is very good. I will frequent this place only for my curry fix and bring as many people as possible to find this gem. Chicken Katsu with chesse level 1 is where you start.
I love Curry... But i love this place the best. Hands down. I cant eat here everyday if I had to. Please try and eat everything. Good for kids and familys as well.

This place is bomb. Love it! It has become a regular spot now but the first time ordering was a little intimidating. However the girl working there was so nice, and explained everything very well and made recommendations. Now we've tried a ton of things and everything is great. I sure hope they get a lot of business because this place needs to stick around!

What's on your plate?
Takiyaki balls (squid balls) 
Original curry 
Chicken katsu curry

So far I'm loving the spicy flavour! My favorite is the takiyaki balls. It is filled with creamy squid goodness! Pair it up with the original curry and you've completed a favorable taste palate.  

Bring heavy pockets because it can get pricy. 

Overall the food is good, maybe I would feel more enthused if the servings matched the price.

My husband and I really love this place! We usually go to the one in China Town but currently discovered this location and it's GREAT. I didn't know they had curry Calamari but we will be trying that on our next visit!!!
Was grateful to attend a conference in Vegas and have time to stop by Zen!  The chicken katsu curry!  Transported me back to Kyushu!   Loved it!

It's an all right location. The quality isn't as good as the Chinatown location. The service was pretty good, but the curry sauce on my chicken katsu was bit cold and less flavorful. The prices are same, but if the quality is not as good then its not worth vising this location.

I lived in Japan for 3 years and am now State side, its sometimes hard to find real Japanese "street" food, food that real people eat all the time. I love this place so much. I think I eat there almost a minimum of 5 times a month! The staff is great, the food is fast. What else can you ask for? My favorite thing on the menu is Spinach curry with brown rice, spice level 10 with a ice cold glass of green tea. So much yes...

The food is explosive with flavor, always fresh, always delicious, and the prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you receive. The only thing I don't like is that they charge extra for spicy level, isn't that why I'm getting curry? But whatevs. It's only 50 cents and well worth it. Plus, the lady at the front counter (I'm sorry I can't remember her name, but she's ALWAYS there) is so damn nice and always is accommodating and pleasant. Japanese curry is now my favorite because of this place. Try the gyoza, hell, get two orders. Trust me, you're going to want them both :-)

Very happy to finally sample this place. Curry is very good and price is reasonable. We order the Chicken Kutsu with curry with spice level two..already very spicy for my taste & side of Japanese Sausage.

This place is in the same shopping center as jennipho on rainbow. Interior had updated furniture and customer service was very good.

I ordered the regular fried chicken breast curry and a side of fried squid. Spice level at 3. It was not bad but I think this got nothing on coco ibichaya curry house. I think that the chicken would be better battered with a little beer to make it more savory. Otherwise I would come back for the fried squid.

I can't believe it took us this long to find CurryZen. Since we left Okinawa Japan we have searched for something like CoCoCurry House! This is it!! The staff was extremely  friendly and the curry was spot on delicious. We will be returning here regularly to enjoy this yumminess! Arigato CurryZen!
This is, hands down, the best Japanese curry restaurant in Las Vegas.  If you don't  come here, you are missing out.  I feel sorry for you.

I always pass by this place & I love curry so I had to try it! I believe I ordered a spice level of 3 or 4 but it still had a solid amount of heat to it. I ordered the chicken katsu curry & it was delicious. It came out pretty fast too so I didn't have to wait long for my to go order but I'm sure you can also call ahead. The food is great & I will definite come back!

I think it's completely rude that they forced us to take our food Togo, even though we ordered 40 min before closing time. I understand that they close at 10 pm, and as someone who works in a restaurant I understand that after a long shift you want to go home. However, I feel like this is completely unacceptable. I will never dine here again. And their curry is mediocre at best. GO TO TONKATSU KYOSHI INSTEAD. SO MUCH BETTER.

VERY good chicken katsu. Excellent quality white meat chicken prepared to perfection. I've had it with curry and white rice and also with the fresh salad (chopped romaine lettuce, julienned carrot, and slices of radish with excellent dressing). If you're craving an ample portion of chicken or pork katsu, this is the place to find it. It's perfect comfort food if you're looking for that. The curry soothes you. It's the same feeling I get when I eat Loco Moco, mashed potatoes, or Mac and cheese! Feel very comforted afterwards :-)

Let me start by saying I'm not a huge curry fan but I'm never against trying something new. I got the chicken katsu curry spice 6. The meal was surprisingly pretty good. The meal consisted of rice (brown or white) the curry sauce and one piece of chicken. Considering the rice is a pretty big portion and the amount of sauce they give you takes up half the container, my only suggestion is they may want to consider serving more than just one piece of chicken. When all the chicken was gone I was pretty much just eating rice with sauce. 

The spicy daikon is a nice touch to the meal as well. 

Be careful when picking the spice because though it goes from 1-10, 5 & 6 is still pretty spicy. This coming from a girl who carries hot sauce in her bag, orders everything extra spice and loves to just casually munch on jalepenos.

Curry was good but wasn't asked if I wanted to add a level of spice and forgot to add it. Dish used to serve our food with are to go containers. I have to give this place 3 stars because of that, definitely creating trash for the environment!! Bill 4 people  was over $40 with no drinks... Chinatown curry zen way better hands down. More on the plate there and a lot cheaper. This place is an expensive fast food joint... This place should definitely be a $$ sign...

Great food, atmosphere, staff. 

Ambience: Clean, bright, understated, but clear about their personality. 
Food: Very good portion, choice, and flavor. Tastes fresh and homemade. Got the Chicken Katsu Curry. 
Service: Amazing and welcoming staff. Excellent prices for the quality.
Amazing curry! The husband and I love this place. It's great to order online through yelp and pick up down the street from my office.

Always been fan of Curry Zen since the day went to the original location on Spring Mountain. Honest never knew they even had express location or second location. Thankfully my yelp nation notice! So picked up on it from other yelpers check in. I read up on it and was like sweet closer to my house need go check it out. I am always paranoid when it comes to seeing multiple locations of one restaurant only because there times expanding can lost the whole reason why people loved it. Curry Zen the quality was spot on just like my first experience. Truly Curry bliss and bring me back to growing up in the 808 going get ono curry action. The curry by itself stands out for me. I could just have a bowl of base curry on top of two scoop or many scoops of rice. Curry heaven. Add the chicken katsu (they have more options comes to protein) perfect! It nice golden brown, perfect crispy panko crust not greasy at all, and spot on cook nice moist and hot on the inside. You can add lot of different things make your curry your own curry action. I keep it simple went with vegetables. The spicy level went 3. I think 3 has nice kick. They go up higher believe 10. I also ordered gyoza. It was delicious. The pork filling was awesome. It was fried perfect. You get five per order and the dipping sauce solid. 

The inside is lot different then the other location. It not so much restaurant restaurant set up but more of express pick up or to go concept. Not that many places sit down. The interior is pretty bland not much decor. They do have on television that can watch sports or whatever on at the time. Make sure you check out the speciality board off the side from the regular menu. 

The lady at the counter was awesome. It was my first time explained the menu picking different components, friendly, and great service. 

No doubt. If craving curry got my go too spot!! Yay!!!!

Loved it. I got the chicken Katsu with spice level 9. Served on a big plate of rice and a large breaded chicken breast with the exquisite sauce made to perfection. The cashier was really nice and full of smiles. Good to see and everyone working there seemed to be enjoying themself which is a good indication that customers are happy. Great place and I would totally return
Was craving Japanese curry and decided to give this place a try. It did not disappoint. Good eats!

Alright if you know of Zen Curry you probably already know they're probably one of the better Japanese style curry we have in town, than again that's only my opinion based on a slim selection I've tried. My favorite at least. This location is a bit different from the other location but nothing to serious about. 

First the price for the curry spice level shot up. It's no longer free for levels 1-5 and 20¢ for levels 6-10. It's 20¢ for levels 1-5 and a nickel more for every level higher. So if you wanted a 10 it's now 45¢ extra instead of 20¢.

Second their express mentality. You now have to place and pickup your order at the counter and you find an open seat or take it go. I would find an open seat before you order if its not slow. You're food is now served in a to go container instead of a non-disposable plate. They started using those styrofoam containers but the last couple times there they were using some plastic containers. I'd rather have it on a plate especially if I'm dining in. Instead of each table having a full assortment of toppings and spices to add to your curry theres just one used by everyone. The most you'll get in terms of customer service is when your at the counter or if you need more water, if it's not to busy they might come to your table. Thats about the only difference. The food taste the same to me and besides the spice levels prices the prices look the same.

The curry sauce is delicious on its own. I like it HOT. At this location I've gotten spice level 5 and a couple of 8s. It made me sweat a little but didn't put my mouth on fire it was just right. Next I'll probably go with the 10 or see what's the hottest they'll make it without killing the taste. The curry can be served with a nice selection ingredients. You can throw some vegetables in it or various meats, chicken, pork, beef, sausage, and even spam. There's also other items which I've never had here yet.

Honestly I wished price was a little lower and the meat portions was a little larger but they've grown on me and I like it, not amazing but good food.

supposedly this is a more simpler version of the zen curry on spring mountain. I see similarities, but the katsu is soft instead of crunchy after being fried. the rice is watery. they present the curry in a narrow, bowl-like, oval plate which leaves less space for food. The sauce seeps into the rice, and I don't like so much sauce at once. It depends on you, how you prefer to eat curry. at the original zen restaurant, the plates are larger and it is much more satisfying to eat curry with. more room, less mess, and overall better presentation. love zen, don't love the zen express though :(

Came by here around 3 PM for a late lunch. Service is nice and fast, curry came out for our party of 3 in under half an hour.

The curry was tasty, a touch sweet, and just the right amount of spice. The rice tasted fresh and well-cooked. We also picked up some croquette, which was excellently cooked.

Make sure to get some delicious chilled water, dispensed free from a filtered machine, which we availed ourselves well from.

The dishes are a bit pricey though, just under $9 for most. The croquette was also a bit pricey, over $2.

They seem to get a bit overwhelmed during "rush hour." We walked into the store and there was a line of about 3-4 orders ahead of us, so I ordered pickup from the Yelp app and sat down. 15 minutes later, after checking on the order, they hadn't even confirmed it. After being here for 20 minutes, a girl from the back called out with an attitude, "is Marcus even here?" (Yea, been here for 20 minutes now smh). The food is good, though.

If you want Japanese curry this place is where you should go. I love how they always give so much curry however if you get corn on the side they don't give as much which is really disappointing. I normally get the chicken katsu which is always really good. Also, if you don't like it spicy but just want a kick get a 1 cause it gets pretty spicy even at 2. This place is not always busy which is nice cause then you could get your food fast.

I am a huge fan of Coco Ichiban and this place is a great substitute!  I have only done takeout since it is not setup as a restaurant.  If you are looking for Japanese curry, look no further, this is the place to go in the southwest!  Welcome to the neighborhood.
It was really busy when I came here, but things are really different from what I remember! The curry, rice, and chicken katsu were all really good!

Edit: portions are better and the food is good. Be careful when ordering pick up. They now give your food on a styrofoam box. 




Rip off! My girlfriend ordered a large chicken Katsu curry bowl and we receive 85% rice! The amount of chicken we got is equivalent to a small or a medium bowl! We paid $12 dollars for a bunch of rice and enough chicken to fit in small potion bowl. What's the point of ordering a bigger sized bowl if all you get is mostly rice?? 

Definitely not coming back here. 

Come here if you love rice! Not the chicken. Such a rip off!

"If I could, baby I'd give you my world
Open up, everything's waiting for you"
- Fleetwood Mac

Curry on the go?...yes please! The resonable price brought me in, but good Japanese Curry keeps me coming back. 

The Spring Mountain location is a superior option in my book, but I don't shy away from this streamlined express version opened by the same owners. 

You can go your own way at Curry Zen by customizing things the way you like them. There's never much of a choice for me here however...call me a creature of habit, but if I'm having Japanese Curry then I want it with Chicken Katsu, a spice level of 7 and an sunny side up egg sitting on top ready to spill forth its glorious yolk.

I normally call ahead or use the Yelp app to order...I wonder if the Yelp app helps deliver a more consistent product, not sure, but it is convenient and comes with great service.
Wow!!!! This stuff is absolutely amazing! Best curry I've ever had and I used to live in an Indian neighborhood in the bay area. Kudos!

If you haven't been to Curry Zen, you are missing out in life. Please try the chicken katsu curry, it's a serious game-changer.  Also, the thai iced tea is delish and the mango cheesecake is a winner.  You can't go wrong here, trust me.  Thank you, Yasu and Dad!!  We'll be back!!
Be cautious with the level of spice you get. I ordered a 6 and it tasted like a 12 spice at Thai restaurants.. And I eat very spicy!

After 3 years I am still coming back here to enjoy some of the best Katsu curry in Las Vegas! I have tried a number of dishes including chicken Katsu curry, fried tofu curry, fried spam curry, yakisoba and yaki udon. 

Your Katsu order comes with white rice and you can choose brown rice for a healthier option. They also have smaller sizes if you just want a single portion (perfect for lunch for 1).

With your order you can also customize the spice level to fit your tastes. I usually order 5-7 which is pretty spicy. If you are not used to spicy curry sauce I would recommend starting at level 3 and go up from there. You can also get a number of toppings to customize your order even more including: corn, cheese, boiled or fried egg, steamed or fried tofu, spam, spinach, vegetables and a variety of meats. 

Thank you Zen Curry House Express for continuing to produce great meals for all of us Katsu Curry lovers!

I loved it and my GF was so so about it. I think I need to try it a few more times but so far so good, I think that the only reason that it was 4 star instead of 5 would be that for the price I would expect slightly higher quality but thats just being a night picky stuffy guy which I am not...
I love the curry with eggs and tomatoes. My favorite menu item there. Staff is friendly and the orders come out quick. I like going there after work after a long day. The food is comforting

Wowser!  I would have loved to give this place a 5 star but the curry was so ridiculously hot!  I ordered a 2 for my spicy it felt like 100!  That was no 2 they gave me.  It was so spicy that I couldn't even enjoy my food.  I barely touched the curry which is the whole reason I came here.  I'm wondering if they put in hotter than I asked.  I like spicy foods but this was so spicy that it made my nose water and my head sweat.  My Thai tea was so delicious and it helped with the heat.  I wanted to really like this place!  Maybe it was a misunderstanding of the heat scale we chose.  But both of us chose level 2 and they both were super spicy but one was more spicy then the other.  It's a shame and a waste because the curry flavor was delicious we just couldn't enjoy it.

I usually never try anything new, until I met my boyfriend. He always makes me try new food and of course this was one of them. I didn't even know what this type of curry was so I just ordered a basic chicken katsu curry. To my suprise it tasted pretty good and the presentation of the food wasn't bad either.

Great curry and even better service! The Hawaiian girl working the counter was as sweet as can be!She was very helpful since it was my first time there. She explained the whole menu and checked on me while I was eating. The food came out fast and hot and delicious! You gotta try the gyoza!

This place is wonderful. The curry is delicious and a good price with large portions. I got the katsu chicken curry with cheese and loved it. Great flavor. I chose a 2 for my level of spicy and it was perfect. Really starts kickin at a 3 if you like things really hot. Great service as well. I will definitely be a repeat customer.

I have been wanting to try this place and do not disappointed. Curry has a great flavor staff is super nice and it's very casual place. Will come back for sure. I ordered udon curry spicy level 3 I should have gotten 5 but the lady said they run on the spicy side. Should've just done the 5 but level 3 is good too.

Was craving curry and came here to check it out! its a quick and easy place to grab a bite! 

I had ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with a spice level of 5, it was delicious and fairly spicy! I think the next time i will move it up to a 6 spice level! The chicken katsu was cooked perfectly. Usually it comes with white rice but this place offers brown rice as well! Along with the katsu they will ask if you would like the pickled radish! I believe its homemade as it had lots of flavor and compliments the dish very well. I will definitely be coming back here real soon!

I went here with my boyfriend last night (Sunday at 7pm or so) and I ordered a level 4 curry and he got a level 8 curry...and our curry tasted exactly the same. The curry was good; I just wish it wasn't that spicy. The atmosphere is casual and it's self-serve. I want to come back in a month or so and I'll update my review.
One of my favorite spots to get my fix for some Curry Chicken Katsu. Their Katsu is never fatty. Curry is always on point - especially when you add some spice and spinach in it. BOMB DOT COM!

This zen curry is located in the rainbow plaza. First time trying Japanese curry and it's not my fav.  I got spicy level 6(it's spicy), and cost .25 cent extra for spicier which I think it's ridiculous.
The curry is not strong and more bland then thai or Viet curry, very thick, not creamy. 
This place is more like a take out restaurant than dine in, they have about 2-3 small table.

I just got an order from here and I must say the food is amazing as usual, BUT the service is awful.  The young women who was working the register tonight has absolutely no customer service skills.  I say "hi, how are you?"  She saying nothing back, then I say "thanks, a lot!" when she hands me my food, again she says nothing.  It's a shame that good food can get overlooked due to horrible service.  Boycott this location and go to the Chinatown location, as the people that work there are so much more friendly!

Abosultely love this place. If youre a curry kinda person. This place is for you! You can add extra items into your dish, spice or no spice. Curry mixed in or on the side. Basically curry the way you want it. Thank goodness they opened one up in the SW area. So convenient. Quick friendly service. And since it's express style versus the restaurant they serve their food is sturdy tupperware like bowls. Which in my eyes is another plus, cause I can save it! Lol.

Everybody says that the original Curry Zen on Spring Mountain is better, but this one is just as bomb, especially if you're on the go!

Service and pricing gets five stars! I usually order to go, and they always get it on time. Every time I've gone, whoever was working the register was always really friendly and helpful!

Adding on extra toppings doesn't break your wallet, so feel free to add on. My favorite meats/mains to get is calamari, croquette, and hamburger. The hamburger is too bomb  The sausages are good too, but you only get a few so it can be kind of disappointing. 

The actual curry is just okay; this is where the Spring Mountain location wins. The actual curry taste isn't as prominent and the spiciness can be inconsistent. Sometimes my spice level is a 6 but fees like a 2, sometimes it is a 3 but feels like an 8. The flavor just gets kind of lost in all the heat. 

Overall, a nice place and one of the few places to get Japanese curry in the southwest. Just be careful of the spice level!

Ughh. They totally served probably the best curry I had so far I have ever had! I ordered veggie curry. Spice level 8. If you loveeeee spicy food. This level is just perfect. I spent around $12 for the curry and a can of soda. Very friendly staff!
The best place to find Spinach Curry... I come here on a regular basis. Food is always cooked to order and Spice level never disappoints!!!

Aye baby, it's simple. This spot is almost as good at curry zen and I think the prices are almost identical. The only inferior thing is the katsu. It's not as juicy, but(t), when I got the spice and the curry and the spinach and the eggs on there, I barely notice. I really had to examine it by its lonesome to notice. 

If you never been to a Japanese Curry spot the closest thing I can compare it to is a spicy, savory (not sweet) hearty gravy. Early on i kept it simple, but, if you see anything on the menu that you might like, get it. It'll only enhance your pleasure. Scrambled eggs might seem random, but I like scrambled eggs and I like it even more with curry and rice and spinach and tomatoes. 

I'm a spice lover with a strong tolerance so, to me anything above a level 5 isn't worth it cuz I don't notice that much difference in intensity. Levels 1 through 5 are all the same additional charge so I just chill at 5. 

Also, strongly recommend the croquette to any potato lovers. It looks like a hash brown but it's more like a lightly breaded, crispy mashed potato. I usually go during lunch. I recommend that if you're pressed for time you call ahead, even if you're dining in. First time, I went it was empty. Last time I went, it was Friday. I ordered about 10 minutes before I got there, and got my food 5 minutes after I paid and sat down. Hope you enjoy
Our go to when we crave for curry. Staff is always friendly and fast. Very similar to the Coco Ichibanya Curry House in Hawaii!

Finally! A decent Japanese curry house close to my house! I will start off by saying that I'm a fan of all things spicy. I went and ordered a chicken katsu curry, then noticed they had level 1-10 spicy. The spice I am accustomed to in Japanese Curry is more of a slow, developing burn rather than the customary immediate heat of Thai or Mexican food so I played it safe and ordered level 7. The plate was delivered to my table pretty quickly, piping hot. I dumped half a jar of the red pickled radishes onto my plate, spooned the curry evenly over the rice and katsu, and dug in. I was SOOOO glad I only got a level 7. Don't get me wrong, the 7 wasn't super spicy, however, served over chicken fresh out of the deep fryer, it felt more like a 10. The curry was heart, hot, spicy, and very good. I think my chicken was overcooked just a little bit, but you won't notice if you soak it in some curry before each bite. The place was clean, service was quick, menu had menu choices. I would definitely go back.

This place has really good curry. I ordered here yesterday thru Yelp's app called Eat24. It was awesome! So convenient. It lets you check the status of your order and gives an estimated time of pick. Also, if you order online from their website, you get 15% off and if it's thru Eat24, you get $2 off. 

The spiciness of the curry is one of the things that I like about this place. I usually get 8 when I order food at like Thai restaurants. But at this place I can only handle 5-6 spice level. It's really good and the portions are huge.

This used to be the spot to go to when my sister and I were off school and of course, I got the chicken katsu curry (lvl 0 spicy) with a side of Thai tea without fail. 
Unlike the Spring Mountain location, this establishment holds no lines and just about everyone who comes in orders to go. If you're dining in, you just order at the counter and sit where you would like. 
I have never had anything to complain about with the employees since they all were so friendly and 
The condiments and the water dispenser are situated next to the counter so there's no need to ask the employees. 
I've been going to the other location since I graduated high school, but I visited this one recently and it hit me right in the feelings. 
Overall, the portions are fairly sized and the service is fast. The establishment is clean and definitely worth the visit.

I got the spinach chicken katsu curry and it was amazing. I got spice level 2 (0-10) and it still had a kick to it but a good kick. The spinach curry was a recommendation from the worker Chara which I'm glad I ordered. They have such great customer service and make you feel welcomed. I will definitely  be coming back.

This place never disappoints! We've been going here for years and I've enjoyed it every time. The parking in this plaza SUCKS but the food is well worth it. Maybe I'm just a little overdramatic, but the curry is on the spicier side. The levels go from 1-10 and a 3 is already pretty spicy for me.... but why get curry if you can't handle the spice right? It's only 10-15 minutes from The Strip, so definitely stop by this place if you're ever visiting!
I am very pleased with Curry Zen! Spice level 2 on the curry is perfect for me. I enjoy both the pork and chicken katsu curries, as well as the takoyaki. Excellent food can never disappoint!
Great place. Loved it. Pork katsu curry was delicious and so was the chicken curry. Will def order from here again

Not sure if owner has been changed since my last visit but, I ordered the same thing I always ordered spinach curry with extra tofu katsu (which is extra charge) when I got home and opened it was just tofu AND they didn't give me any red radishes they used to...i always tip on my to-go orders too and I wish they would give me options to get mine just plain because even it's level 1 it's still kinda spicy for me

I love the curry here. Tofu katsu is amazing.
Beware the spice levels.. most places who have a rating from 1-10 i usually start off with a 7 which turns out to be perfect, this place keeps me at a cool 5 because their level 7 was a little much and I want to actually taste my food not have it punch me in the face as I bite into it.

There is a little donation box with lollipops.. I put a dollar in but didn't want to take a lollipop... I felt the burning on my back from judging eyes from people around me. Let me have my lollipop, I paid for it!! Lol

TL;DR: really big portion sizes, good side dishes

I'm not usually a fan of curry, but Curry Zen may have changed my mind! Generous portion sizes, affordable menu options, and varied sizes made for a really good first experience at this restaurant. Even if curry may not be your preferred food, you may find something that surprises you.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with corn and cheese.

CHICKEN KATSU CURRY (4/5)
- HUGE portion size
- Spicy level 4 wasn't unbearable at all
- Not a lot of variety in flavor, but curry sauce paired well with meat
- I enjoyed the corn, but the cheese was a little much?

The cashier and staff were very nice. He brought our meals out to our table and asked if we needed anything. At first, the sides were forgotten on my meal, but that was quickly fixed. Again, I'm no expert when it comes to curry. I enjoyed my experience here and I think it will help me try out other similar restaurants in the future.

Great find ! Shumai and gyoza - basic but good. Tofu and Chix Katsu salad - awesome probably the homemade dressing ! Curry was good will definitely be back ! Green Tea cheesecake good 2!
Small restaurant but I'm sure soon enough they will need to expand !
Must try !

I've been eating at this particular restaurant since they've opened and always had good service until today. The Asian girl working the register needs a heavy dose of customer service. She didn't even acknowledged that I was standing in front of her. When she finally looked up at me I had to ask her if she was ready for me to order? Same as I watched other customers come in and out. The only time she smiled was when talking to the other employees. That experience alone made my food crappy. I'll continue it to eat there but if I walk in and she's there I'm going for something else.

Love this amazing delicious place. I come here often, like all the time. Always come hungry and leave super satisfied with a to go box. My favorite of all time is hands down the chicken katsu curry with veggies. I usually eat spicy, but this curry spice gets hot, so I usually go mild. Sapporo in an iced mug with my curry is priceless. No where in town have I found chicken katsu curry this freaking good. Loyal customer forever.

Their spice levels are perfect! I always get spice level 10 and it is amazing. Ingredients are fresh and tasty and their staff is super friendly and helpful. Sure, it may not have the same atmosphere as the other Curry Zen, but you have to judge this restaurant based on its own merits. Food is wonderful, service is great! For such a small location, Express is doing a fantastic job.

I love this place, the food is delicious. I always get chicken katsu spicy level 5 with white rice and a side of shrimp. The staff is great, it's a great place to go for lunch you get your food quickly and it's been perfect every time.

I love this place! I hope their dream of expanding to the north comes true because I will be there!

What's to love? I am finally getting to understand the differences in different curries and Japanese style is my favorite. Curry is not created equal. I have ordered it where it is a gelatinous glob, this was really nice. They do have a  1-10 scale and I insisted on a 5. We have all been there where we like heat and every place is a little different. They are not playing with the heat so a 5 is hot! It is better to go lower then add if you want to feel the burn. 

What I loved, when you order the rice, sauces or meats you can adjust the amounts for each addition. So if you are watching your carbs you are not tempted by the 300 cal scoop of rice that you may have to throw away. What was awesome, the price is adjusted instead of having to pay for food you might throw away! This is genius in my book! I also ordered a small salad and did not have to pay a large dollar amount for a simple salad. That too is great!

The dining room was very clean and that is a good sign. My future outing will include a trip to the restroom because if it is dirty I am not staying!  My only mini dislike and it is personal, I hate seeing a bus tray in the dining area. The space is so beautiful that it takes away from the beauty. 

I will be back! 

Arigato!

Delectable, authentic Japanese curry served in a lively and clean atmosphere. We had the chicken katsu curry, the chicken was expertly prepared. Light, crispy, with juicy chicken. The curry can be ordered from zero to 10 in spiciness. My other half had #4 and said it left a pleasant pulse on the lips and cleared the sinuses out just fine :) On the tables you will find fukujinzuke (red pickled daikon radish blend) and rakkyo (pickled Chinese onion) thoughtfully provided as relishes for your meal.

The service is so friendly and efficient. Yes, the restaurant has express in its name, but be patient as everything is made strictly to order. The only error on our plates were the fried eggs we ordered as a topping had rock hard yolks, not the runny goodness you want. 

Finally, what is bizarre about this place is the music they play, which just doesn't fit the experience... All Reggae.... Honto ni? How about some J-pop!

I LOVE, LOVE curry so I was kinda bummed out when I found out there wasn't a Curry House near me. This place does make a good substitute until I can go back home. 

I ordered the chicken katsu curry with a side order of takoyaki. The portion is pretty good for the price, so you can't really go wrong with that. The only thing that sucks is that when you request some red pickles, they only give you a small portion instead of having them at the table in a container where you can serve yourself to your heart's content. Takoyaki is a hit or miss because the outer shell was crispy the first time I ordered it, but the second time it was kind of doughy :(. 

I'd say give this place a try if you are craving for some Japanese style curry while you are in the Vegas area. It isn't as good as Curry House or Coco Ichibanya, but it is better than some of the other places I have tried.

It is located in a small plaza so parking might be tough depending on the time you get to the restaurant. Also, it is located near Kung Fu tea so you can literally walk for a few seconds and get boba for dessert! They also charge for making your curry spicy so don't be surprised by the extra cost.

I just recently moved into this neighborhood. I love curry and saw the 4 outa 5 stars and was excited to check them out! It was Wednesday night around 8:15pm. There was one person in front of me. I was reading the overhead menu deciding what I wanted to order while I was in LINE. Another patron walked in the front door. The front counter girl knew him and and he started to rattle off his order. I told her that had been waiting and that the guy cut in front of me. She continued to help the guy who cut because she obviously knew him. Too bad I had to leave immediately without ordering and I'll NEVER go back due to the lack of customer service at Curry Zen. She didn't care and proceeded to talk crap about me to the loyal customer.  As a small business owner I'd be appalled if ANY of  my customers were not treated equally.  I'm not sure if it was just this employee or a management issue but I'll be sure to not patronize this business and tell ALL friends likewise.

Definitely my favorite food. It is filling and has great flavors. My usual order is pork katsu curry with cheese and corn. Just thinking about it already makes me drool!!They're fast and affordable. Their thai tea is puuurty good. Overall,if you want something quick,filling and cheap you can never go wrong with curry zen!
I was addicted to this place for 2 weeks straight and still come from time to time for the chicken Katsu curry! LOVE LOVE LOVE
Nothing fancy but if you're needing a quick fix of Japanese curry, then yes, this is the place to go.  The dining area is in no way fancy but the food is good and the service is quick and friendly.
Amazing food!!! Amazing service!!!! You can't go wrong w/their vegetables & chicken Katsu curry.

My brother and I randomly came in one day to try out this place and we fell in love. They greet you when you walk in the door and theyre so friendly. I love getting the pork katsu with mixed vegetables mixed in with my curry. The fried spam is also delicious its just like a salty chicken nugget lol. I come in very often and the portions are big for the price. I recommend this place to everyone! They made a loyal customer out of me.

I have to admit I wasn't aware this was a Curry Zen Express but that didn't matter after we tried their food!  I ordered the chicken katsu and my husband had the pork katsu. We were not disappointed!  The spice levels are pretty spicy so order a 1 or 2 if you're a sissy like me.

First time here and it won't be my last! 

I'm surprised this place doesn't get as much foot traffic as the ramen place next door. But i'm not complaining. If you're craving for some good Japanese curry..this place is it! Their chicken katsu is crispy and juicy. Very deliciously well made. I do have to warn you if you can't handle your spice..do try to order the level more mild. I ordered level 8 and it was just enough for me. Good thing I didn't go for the max because I probably wouldn't have been able to handle it. Waitress was very nice and the restaurant was very clean. Very family friendly so good if you have kids!

I'm glad my friend introduced me to this place and its next to a boba spot too!

Yelp Review 2017 Challenge 70/100

This place is a chip off the old block, great flavor and food like the other location.  If I'm closer to this location, I'll come here instead of the one on Spring Mountain to get my Japanese curry fix.  I've never been disappointed here  :)
Great curry with good spice. Reasonable price for quality of food. Service was fast and easy. Brand new snd very clean. Try it

I'm confused.  Is it Zen Curry Express or Curry Zen?  Oh well.  I go here every trip to Las Vegas.  And although a friend is the manager, I'm going to give you an unbiased opinion of Zen Curry Express.

Let me talk about the curry.  Why?  Because that's why we're all going there, so I might as well just get straight to the point.  The curry is typical of Japanese curry.  Very flavorful and thick.  They give you different spice level options from nothing to lava hot.  Of course, you'll pay a little more for a spicier curry.

I always order the chicken katsu curry, fried gyoza, Shirakiku ramune drink and if they have it this curry pastry thing (it's pretty tasty.  It's kinda like an India samosa).  I've been here about 4 times and I've never been disappointed.  The food is good.  The prices are good.  The service is excellent.  Parking is ample and I leave with a full stomach.  

Good job guys!

Was so excited that a Zen curry opened up just 2 minutes from where we stay. But,Not a fan of the "express" experience. My food was sticking to the to-go plate that it is served on even if you're dining in. It also absorbed all my curry sauce. So glad the food tastes just as amazing as the original location! I'd much rather commute to Spring Mountain for the authentic aura/experience. 

Arigato!!

Curry here is OK at best. I'm used to having curry that's served hot enough that u can see the steam coming out. Curry at zen came out too thick n warm. Felt like something u pop in the microwave n didn't heat it long enough. The people working there were nice n friendly that's why there are 2 stars instead of 1. Needless to say that will be my first n last time eating there.
Wow was impressed how authentic the food was here. I got the chicken katsu don and it was delicious. My friend got the curry katsu and he was impressed too. Keep in mind my friend is very picky.

Great place to get your curry quick fix at this express location. Food is yummy, service is good, and food comes out quick.

I'm basic and normally just always get the chicken katsu curry and it's sooo good. Be careful when choosing spice levels! I love spicy food and I normally get a spice level 5 which is the perfect spice for me-- spicy but still enjoyable. My boyfriend gets no spice because he thinks even the littlest of spice level is too spicy.

I'd definitely recommend this place to whoever likes curry and I'd definitely be back often since I'm staying in this area temporarily.

Quick and convenient place to grab some good curry katsu. They have really fast and friendly service so I've become a solid regular here now. My go to order is the chicken katsu curry. All in all it's definitely not bad. Is it the best curry/katsu I've ever had? No but for the price and convenience I'm definitely still a fan!

There's tons of parking in the complex and the wait is never that bad. I usually like calling my order in ahead and it's usually just a 10 min wait. You can also create your order curry here. You pick your meat (chicken/pork katsu, spam, etc) then your curry and spice level then your amount and type of rice! Tons of options and combos to fit your curry desires.

I really love this place. My favorite is the Chicken Katsu curry. The chicken is very moist and flavorful. The crunchy coating is perfect! Served with rice and a wonderful thick curry sauce that you can make as spicy as you like. Can't wait to go back.

I was driving around to find something to eat and I saw this place, which is pretty close to my house. The menu has many options and I asked the employee at the front of what does she recommend to me since it's my first time here. She recommends the Chicken Katsu with curry and add on with vegetables so I decided to try that. The add ons are like $1-2 extra though so my meal added up to about $13. There's also spice level from 1-10 and I tried 3. The portion was pretty big and 3 is definitely spicy enough for me, so be careful of what spice level you choose! It was pretty good and I was full fast. I even took a to-go box for my leftovers. The girl employee (which I forgot to ask for her name) provided great customer service and I appreciated that. Next time I would like to try their ramen, it sounds good!

First time eating here today. I ordered the fried shrimp curry with corn and cheese for myself and a pork katsu curry for my other half. The curry itself is delicious. Really flavorful, lots of curry and rice. I can't handle a lot of spice, so I got a level 3 thinking it'd just add nice flavor. Hahaha, no. My mouth is on fire, how do you regulars get anything over 5? I feel like such a wuss. Still, tastes really awesome though. 

My only problem is that my bowl only came with 3 shrimp and that's almost 5 dollars for them. I'm used to shrimp being more expensive, but when comparing my tiny portion of shrimp to a massive chunk of pork, I get kind of sad. So that's why I had to take off a star; for the semi-pricey meat add on options.

This place has a simple menu which I like. The portions are pretty damn big and the price is decent. To top it off, the food is the bomb. If you love spicy food, this place is for you. However, I must warn you. Don't be overzealous like me and get the spiciest level because you're "used" to hot food. You're not. ;)

I have been waiting patiently for this place to open and while driving by last week, I saw the lights on and dove in for a look. I decided to go in and give it a taste-test. I ordered 3 dishes, chicken katsu curry, pork katsu curry and the sausage curry. I was happy to discover this place was no "Hawaiian-like BBQ" serving a sad excuse for curry. The curry was full of flavor, texture appealing and reminded me of the standard I learned growing up in Hawaii. The katsu was seasoned perfectly and perfectly cooked. My only complaint (which really isn't a complaint) is the "Zero" level was still a little bit spicy. Not so much that it's unappetizing, but more than we were expecting. However, would I order it again? Absolutely! I just found my new favorite curry joint. And it's close to home, too! Think about take-out, the seating area is small. Service is happy and efficient fronting an open kitchen.

I've only been twice but intend to go many more times! Be careful - the heat gets very hot, very quickly (luckily the girl who took my order the first time informed me of this and I only got a heat level of 1). You can totally customized your meal, adding on various vegetables, cheese. I also really appreciate the portion selection. So far everything I have tried has been great, can't wait to keep going back and trying more of the menu!

Yeah, a new great restaurant close to home offering many different curry delights. The menu is simple making ordering easy. Love the Blazen scale and imagine that the hottest level must leave your mouth burning for days. I only went spicy level number three and that had one hell of a kick. The curry sauce has great flavor. Went with the chicken Katsu curry with a potato croquet, corn, and sausage. A good call because all the items worked well with each other. The drink selection is lacking. Would be great if they had a bigger display case full of Republic of Teas. But I guess it is a space issue. Very friendly and helpful service with a smile. Orders are expedited in a timely fashion that leaves you feeling wonderful about making the decision to eat here!

This is my go-to place whenever I'm craving curry! I love that I have this as an option on the sw side, so I don't always have to go to spring mtn for my
curry fix! Their spice levels are perfect and they have such a great selection of meats, toppings and sides! I always get the pork katsu curry and it never disappoints! Their portions are perfect sized and they give a good amount of meat for the price! The customer service is just as good as the food and I've never had a less than great experience here! I would definitely recommend!

AUTHENTIC JAPANESE CURRY!!! FINALLY!!!

I lived in Tokyo for three years and loved frequenting this curry restaurant there called CoCo Curry House Ichibanya. It was the first time I had Japanese curry made from scratch and it was amazing. Who knew curry could taste so good!

It's been ~ten years. Ten years longing for the spicy oh-so-comforting curry with that perfect warm side of naan. Of course I've made curry at home, but it's just not the same.

Thank God for Curry Zen!!! This place satisfied the relentless growing craving I've had since coming back to the states. The curry is savory, but not too heavy -- flavorful, but not overpowering. It's perfect.

I like really spicy food so I got an 8 and thought i could still crank up the heat. But my boyfriend --who also likes spicy food got a 5 and said it was perfect. Up to you. They technically go up to 100. Haha, next time I'll try the 10.

Also-- the Tonkatsu here is really great. Fried food is on point.

My only problem though-- which is why this is a 4 and not a 5 star review is that the food came out at a warm temperature. I prefer my curry coming out piping hot! (:

Still- the best curry I've had in the states. I'll just have to ask them to heat it up a little more next time. Worth it.

The portions are tiny in comparison to other curry spots, which is pretty sad :( I was super hungry too! Haha. The flavor is good and tasty though. The mango cheesecake was alright... nothing special. It was the size of my palm. The curry katsu chicken was good as well, nothing too special.

Ordered the Pork Katsu Curry with vegetables and white rice, takoyaki balls, and the mango cheesecake for lunch. 

This is my first time eating at Curry Zen (via Uber Eats) but I probably won't order from here again.

First of all, I only ordered the Pork Katsu Curry because a few reviewers favored it over the Chicken Katsu. 

Big mistake! 

If I had to do it all over again, I'd order the Chicken Katsu or Sausage Curry, not only because they're cheaper, but because the Pork was so dry, it was absolutely inedible without the curry sauce. 

Second of all, the curry lacked a complexity of flavor. I did like it. Loved the heat, but I wish it was a bit more balanced. Pretty good but it was definitely missing something. 

Third, everyone raves about their takoyaki balls, but I didn't like them. It could just be my palette, but I didn't like how mushy and fishy-tasting they were. If you mushy and fishy, they are right up your alley.

Lastly, my favorite part of the whole meal was the Mango Cheesecake. Yum!! Other reviewers complained about how small the cheesecake was (and yes, it's small) but I thought it was well worth the price. It had little mango chunks inside that were so good. The cheesecake had a quality taste to it - all in all, very delicious. 

Ranking of the meal:
#1 Mango Cheesecake
#2 Curry Sauce with Vegetables
#3 White Rice (perfectly cooked, no issues)
#4 Takoyaki (eh..)
#5 Pork Katsu (Yuck!)

Yum! Since it's easier to get to Vegas than to the 808 for some wholesome Japanese Curry, I'm glad I discovered this place -- well my  husband did so he gets the credit. The curry here is definitely on point -- silky smooth and has levels of spice just the way I like it. I love that I can add things to it like cheese and corn! Yum! 

I had the chicken katsu which remained crispy as I ate it with the curry sauced poured all over it! I'll be back here again for sure!

Loved the original place in Chinatown, so finding out this place was right down the street made me super excited! The curry is packed with flavor. I love getting the chicken katsu with curry, comes with rice. So great! I also got a side of croquette (think of the katsu batter but it's around potato). Missing a star due to the experience outside of the food. I felt bad for the workers, you could see how stressed they were trying to balance cooking the food, taking orders... and all the tables besides one was left dirty from the patrons before. My friends and I had to clean up other ppls mess  definitely should try to make some kind of system to make the flow of everything smoother. Other than that, definitely check it out for some good food!

I've never eaten inside the restaurant, and usually pick up food on the way home from work. 
You can order from Yelp, or use their app (10% off the first order), and they send you an email  to confirm what time your order will be ready. This is really convenient and the ordering process takes just a couple minutes max. 

The staff at the counter are friendly. If you do plan to eat here, there is seating. 

What to order, you guessed it... Curry. 
You can have it anyway you want with all the options they have: Chicken, Pork, Vegetables, Noodles, Rice, and so on. 

What we get is: 
Chicken Katsu 
Spicy 5-7
Add fried egg, vegetables, extra sauce, and almond slivers & raisins on the side. 
With all of this food, it is enough for 2 people to share, or you can just save for leftovers. 

We'll be back this soon since this has become a weekly pick up staple for us.

If you passed by Curry Zen on the street, you'd probably not want to go in. GO IN! this is one of those amazing hole in the wall spots that serves up some of the best tasting curry I've had! If you go in and sit and take a look at the menu... they took some TERRIBLE pictures. But it's all so delicious!!!

FOOD: I got the lvl 5 veggie and shrimp udon. Simple perfection. It was a great portion, had enough for lunch next day and was perfect lvl of heat for me. I also had the fried Oysters (3/5) and naan bread (I think it's a type of curry sauce that comes with it, but wasn't too big of a fan of that). 

SERVICE: Fantastic! Loved everyone serving, and we had multiple visits while we ate to ensure we were all good.

I'd given up on finding good ramen on this street after hearing so many disencouraging things about nearby Omoide. I guess I was wrong to lose faith.

Curry Zen Express is an outpost of Japanese Curry Zen on Spring Mountain that appears to serve most if not all of the same products. However, it is to-go oriented, as evidenced by the lack of "proper" dinnerware. Everything is served with plastic disposable bowls/plates and utensils, even if you're eating in. That's not a big deal as long as the food is good and the condiments are sufficient, both of which certainly are the case.

I saw Curry Pan ($2.00) on the counter under a clear plastic cover. Having read words of praise for this item from the original restaurant but having never tried it before, I had to order one now. They offered to (re-)heat it, which I eagerly accepted, and it arrived at the table warm and fresh-tasting. With a crunchy breaded exterior and a savory veggie curry filling, it's not lifechanging, but it's a yummy appetizer / side dish that you should try at least once.

Instead of going for the traditional curry, I went for the "new" curry ramen ($8.95), which I later realized was on the other menus as well. Still, it sounded like a great idea on a cool, windy day, and the curry broth proved eventually to be every bit as flavorful and spice-filled as their signature curry. I again struggled with the #3 (+$0.20 for levels 1-5) out of 10 heat level, with sweat almost dripping from my head at times. It's a tough life with that spiciness sensitivity (#firstworldproblems), but it's fortunate that I don't have to pay more for the higher spice levels.

As for the other components, I was happy enough with the firmness of the thick noodles, and I enjoyed the various veggies in the bowl too. I did suffer a slight disappointment upon noticing that the pork comes as thinly sliced portions of meat that have absolutely zero relation to pork belly, much less chashu. Judging this dish as a ramen, it's good but not the best. But as a curry dish, it's a very good variant. Just make sure to add fukujinzuke (the red-colored sweet pickled daikon) to add some necessary depth of flavor. This complimentary condiment complements the curry the same whether it comes as a thinner ramen broth or the thicker standard form.

I will certainly be back to Curry Zen Express soon to enjoy their curry with rice and protein. Judging from the curry flavor of the ramen, I'm almost certain it will be the same quality as the original. Furthermore, this location does have a key advantage over the other one: it's across the street from the unparalleled Gelatology and a block away from the best-in-town Brew Tea Bar. The frozen dessert spot and the milk tea / coffee shop next to Japanese Curry Zen just don't match up.
This place is yummy and satisfies my curry fix but the price can add up really easy.  But it is yummy!  So I still come occasionally even though it's somewhat a drive.

If the intention for this location is express I would suggest it be stated some where. 

As faithful customers before the original location was remodeled we were surprised in the differences yet understanding that this location seems to be meant for take out rather than dine in even though they offer dine in. It could be that they just opened and will upgrade things later. 

***It's hard not to compare locations but the food is exactly the same and the prices are the same which we were very happy about.***

Differences: When you walk in you aren't greeted with a direction of a table or take out at the counter. More of a stand there and figure it out feel. You do need to order at the counter regardless. They have what would typically be on each table in a bar form (raisins etc). I was not happy dinning in to receive a plastic container to eat out of and plastic forks however, I did not receive styrofoam so that's a plus to previous reviews. *Even at their smallest they offered dinner dishes and silverware. Since you've already paid, if you want dessert you'd need to pay again so I think that's a negative for business. Once you're done dinning in you'll need to clear your tray, discard trash etc. understandable for an express feel. 

Overall I personally would rather drive all the way to the original location for the feel of dinning out and use this location for take out only.

The rice was as if it was the same one used from the day before. Curry and katsu was okay, the original location was better. The service the first time around was really great, but the 2nd time the service was worse. The lady with glasses didn't take the right order when it was clearly stated, she also seemed too busy with her phone. There was no receipt given, overall the 2nd time, service was quite awful.

I could probably eat this every single day.  Dishes are always great and I do not have any complaints.  I eat here with team at least once a month and its safe to say we all really really like it .  Do not go over '5' on their spicy scale otherwise you might have some issues finishing the meal!

I would highly recommend the chicken katsu with vegetables and corn.
Enjoy.

This is my go to place whenever I want my Chicken Katsu Curry fix.  Always get the Chicken Katsu Curry level 3 with a side order of Takoyaki.

I usually go to the one in Chinatown, but now I'm going to start coming to this location. Clean area. Friendly staff. Great food.
This place is place away from home! Have the best chicken Katsu hands down!!! When I miss my zippys chicken katsu, I go to this place. Quality & quantity, check check! Thank you

omg, how can a sausage turn to the best sausage evaahhh! I dont know how you guys are making your curry sauce but dang, I am getting addicted to it.

I always order sausage and spinach with cheese and geesh it's the bomb! The Curry just run so smooth to my throat. Gaaah I am having some foodgasm on every bite.

Oh by the way, please make sure you choose the level of spiciness wisely. I just always have mine from 2-3 :)

You can try their Katsu and shrimp too.  ****highly recommended

This is definitely comfort food. The staff is super nice and welcoming. I always get the chicken katsu curry with sausage and spicy #4 with a Thai tea. Just the right amount of spice. I've gone here more than once in a week a few different times.

Very disappointed in this place we got there at 11:10am they didn't open up until 11:30am the door was already unlocked and we were just looking at the menu outside and someone walked up to the door and locked it so we went down to another restaurant. They should have opened the door and either said we open at 11:30am or come on in.

I like the spring mountain location better....I was shocked to find out they serve in styrofoam....when I receive the curry, I can taste the styrofoam....it's just not the same, I was also surprised to get charged extra 20 cents when I tell them i just want spicy level 1 (in old location level 0~4 is free), I don't know if I want to come back..... :(

The one star was for the yummy curry. 

Staff on the other hand, well let's just say that they have no good customer service whatsoever. If they don't like handling customers then don't work in this business. Well I guess I can understand since try have no choice than to work in fast food.
